intro: Hieracium isoptortum, commonly known as the bent-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium isoptortum is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in many regions.
